text: Agriculture is made up of livestock production, aquaculture, fisheries, forestry, animal husbandry and farming (or crop production). From agriculture one can get food and non-food products. == Origin == The word agriculture comes from late Middle English which formed it partly from Middle French from the Latin word agricultura. Agricultura comes from the ager/agr meaning “field” and cultura meaning “growing, cultivation”. == Examples == Some forms of agriculture are: *Fish hatchery *Oyster farming, a kind of aquaculture *Growing cotton *Growing tobacco *Growing trees for lumber (or forestry) and logginghttps://www.epa.gov/agriculture/agriculture-and-forestry. EPA.gov *Raising cattle or other livestock *cereals (grains), *vegetables, *fruits, *meat, *milk, *eggs, and *mushroom Important kinds of agricultural products are: *fibers *fuels *raw materials (such as rubber). *classes (or kinds) of food There are views about what is different between farming and agriculture.https://unacademy.com/content/difference-between/farming-and- agriculture/. Unacademy.com. Retrieved 2023-07-31https://edurev.in/question/442041/What-is-difference-between- farming-and-agriculture. Edurev.in. Retrieved 2023-07-31 ==Disciplines== *Agricultural economics *Agricultural science **Agronomy In at least one country, education is available to become an Agricultural scientist; People with that job, do "implementation of [... things like] crop production, livestock management, and sustainable farming methods".https://www.purdue.edu/science/careers/what_can_i_do_with_a_major/Career%20Pages/agricultural- scientist.html. Retrieved 2025-04-15 ==Sources==
title: Agriculture
